[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: ValidatorSet] [Config versioning] If validator set config changes format between epochs, do all validators agree on which version to use, or can version mismatches split the network? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: Consensus] [Config caching] If consensus code caches OnChainConfig values, can stale caches persist after epoch transitions causing validators to use outdated rules? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: Consensus] [Reconfiguration timing] Can epoch changes triggered by ConfigurationResource updates occur mid-round, causing consensus to apply inconsistent rules across round boundaries? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: GasSchedule] [Gas config injection] Can malicious proposals modify gas configs through ConfigurationResource to set gas prices to zero, enabling infinite transaction spam? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: ExecutionConfig] [Execution mode changes] Can rapid config changes between parallel/sequential execution modes cause validators to produce different state roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: Storage] [Config persistence] Are config updates persisted atomically with state root updates, or can crashes during config writes corrupt the config database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Integration: Storage] [Config history pruning] Does storage pruning preserve config history needed for replaying old transactions, or can pruning break historical validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Epoch 0] [Genesis handling] Does epoch 0 have special handling, or can logic that assumes epoch > 0 underflow and cause panics? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Epoch MAX] [Maximum epoch] What happens when epoch reaches u64::MAX, can the system continue or does it require a hard fork? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Rapid reconfigurations] [Rate limiting] Can malicious governance proposals trigger rapid successive reconfigurations faster than validators can process, causing liveness loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Missing config] [Fallback behavior] When fetch_config() returns None, do validators use safe defaults or panic, and are defaults consistent across all implementations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Empty bytes] [Zero-length deserialization] Can empty byte arrays deserialize into valid configs with zero-initialized fields, potentially creating invalid protocol states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Null configs] [Presence validation] Is config presence checked before use, or can null/absent configs cause null pointer dereferences in FFI boundaries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Generic configs] [Type erasure] For configs with generic type parameters, can type erasure cause validators to deserialize into wrong concrete types? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Edge case: Nested configs] [Recursive depth] Can configs contain nested structures with unbounded recursion depth, causing stack overflow during deserialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Governance] [Config replacement] Can a malicious governance proposal replace critical configs like ValidatorSet mid-epoch, causing active validators to lose authority? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Governance] [Config deletion] Can governance delete essential configs like GasSchedule, causing all transactions to fail and halting the chain permanently? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Governance] [Partial update] Can proposals update only part of a config, leaving it in an inconsistent intermediate state that violates invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Timing] [Deserialization timing] Can attackers measure deserialization time differences to infer secret config contents through side-channel analysis? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Timing] [Cache timing] Do config reads have predictable timing based on cache hits, allowing attackers to infer validator config access patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Resource exhaustion] [Large configs] Can extremely large config payloads (approaching max BCS size) cause memory exhaustion during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Resource exhaustion] [Config enumeration] Can attackers enumerate all possible ConfigIDs to discover hidden or debug configs not intended for production? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Resource exhaustion] [Repeated deserialization] Can repeatedly calling fetch_config() for the same config exhaust CPU resources if deserialization is expensive and not cached? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Type confusion] [Config aliasing] Can two configs with identical binary representation but different types both deserialize successfully, allowing type confusion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/mod.rs] [Attack: Type confusion] [Struct tag manipulation] Can attackers craft transactions that modify the struct tag metadata to redirect config reads to wrong types? (High)
